channel.title: Behance Featured Projects
channel.description: The latest projects featured on the Behance

item.title: 'LUCIA' (Graphic Novel)
item.description: Here is a selection of work from my upcoming Graphic Novel 'Lucia', My second Graphic novel but the first one I have both written and illustrated this is a tiny selection of pages and frames in no particular order most of which I have posted on my blog http://andyhixon.blogspot.com , the book is 96 pages full colour in total (ive been slaving away on this for the past 7 months on and off and it has now reached its pitching to publisher stage which is a job and a half in itself). The text is still needing some formatting its more a work in progress at the moment. I will upload alot more at a later stage. Andy
item.content:encoded: Here is a selection of work from my upcoming Graphic Novel 'Lucia', My second Graphic novel but the first one I have both written and illustrated this is a tiny selection of pages and frames in no particular order most of which I have posted on my blog http://andyhixon.blogspot.com , the book is 96 pages full colour in total (ive been slaving away on this for the past 7 months on and off and it has now reached its pitching to publisher stage which is a job and a half in itself). The text is still needing some formatting its more a work in progress at the moment. I will upload alot more at a later stage. Andy

item.title: Playing Card Exploration
item.description: Recently I had a chance to work with a playing card company that sparked my excitement over developing backs to playing cards. Here is a collection of pieces I've developed in this personal exploration to challenge myself in new techniques.
item.content:encoded: Recently I had a chance to work with a playing card company that sparked my excitement over developing backs to playing cards. Here is a collection of pieces I've developed in this personal exploration to challenge myself in new techniques.

item.title: Oxford University Clinical Research Unit
item.description: Oxford University Clinical Research Unit. Purposely ambiguous these coloured shapes feel scientific. They can be viewed as a sequence of chromosomes, a course of medical treatment, or a group of bacteria, even people. They may simply be a colorful respite in a sterile environment. What the sequence does represent is the process of searching for answers making sense out of something that at first has none. It represents problem solving and offers rewards to those that do. Very simply each letter represents a letter of the alphabet.
item.content:encoded: Oxford University Clinical Research Unit. Purposely ambiguous these coloured shapes feel scientific. They can be viewed as a sequence of chromosomes, a course of medical treatment, or a group of bacteria, even people. They may simply be a colorful respite in a sterile environment. What the sequence does represent is the process of searching for answers making sense out of something that at first has none. It represents problem solving and offers rewards to those that do. Very simply each letter represents a letter of the alphabet.

item.title: The Lost World watercolor patterns
item.description: These designs could be widely used in textile or fashion industry and in any other field. So I am open for any business proposals. Patterns were created with pencil and watercolor on watercolor paper. Then paintings were edited in Photoshop.
item.content:encoded: These designs could be widely used in textile or fashion industry and in any other field. So I am open for any business proposals. Patterns were created with pencil and watercolor on watercolor paper. Then paintings were edited in Photoshop.

item.title: Jpeople Magazine ?16
item.description: Dreams never end It takes a lot of courage to show your dreams to someone else. Erma Bombeck That is what we are doing in this issue. We are opening the magazine with an insight into what dreams mean to us. So let us take you to another journey about Truth, Styles & Imagination. This is our new Issue. ?16 soon in shops all over the world and online! - www.jpeoplemagazine.com

item.title: Washington Post Q Covers 2012
item.description: Over the last year I've been commissioned by the The Washington Post to create typographic illustrations for the cover of the Business section at the end of each financial quarter. These are the past 4.

item.title: Nike+ Training
item.description: Nike + Training is an interactive mobile application that interfaces wirelessly with shoes that are enabled with motion and pressure sensors. Allowing you to track how high you jump, how fast you move, and how intense your workout is. I spent two years playing a lead role in the design of the digital experience. Agency: R/GA Visual Credits Creative Director: Wade Convay Art Director: Saulo Rodrigues Lead Designers: Erik Finsrud, Ty Saunders Other contributors: Young Seo, Jordan Fripp Photos: Saulo Rodrigues
item.content:encoded: Nike + Training is an interactive mobile application that interfaces wirelessly with shoes that are enabled with motion and pressure sensors. Allowing you to track how high you jump, how fast you move, and how intense your workout is. I spent two years playing a lead role in the design of the digital experience. Agency: R/GA Visual Credits Creative Director: Wade Convay Art Director: Saulo Rodrigues Lead Designers: Erik Finsrud, Ty Saunders Other contributors: Young Seo, Jordan Fripp Photos: Saulo Rodrigues

item.title: Doha Film Institute
item.description: Working closely with the Doha Film Institute (DFI), an independent cultural organization based in Qatar, we developed a comprehensive and highly flexible identity and design system. The DFI brand campaign "I am Film" features an on-going portrait project by photographer Brigitte Lacombe focusing on the iconic and emerging figures of the Arab film industry. Building on DFI's mission of promoting, educating and cultivating passion for great filmmaking, we continue to work with DFI and its annual film event, the Doha Tribeca Film Festival (DTFF) a cultural partnership with Tribeca Enterprises to create campaigns, events, exhibitions, publications and branded collateral in Qatar and its satellite locations in New York, Paris, and Cannes. Our work for the 2011 DTFF includes a mile-long billboard of 600 Lacombe portraits surrounding the Katara Cultural Village where the festival takes place, books documenting the "I am Film" project and the making of the Jean-Jacques Annaud film "Black Gold," and environmental projections and signage throughout the event.
item.content:encoded: Working closely with the Doha Film Institute (DFI), an independent cultural organization based in Qatar, we developed a comprehensive and highly flexible identity and design system. The DFI brand campaign "I am Film" features an on-going portrait project by photographer Brigitte Lacombe focusing on the iconic and emerging figures of the Arab film industry. Building on DFI's mission of promoting, educating and cultivating passion for great filmmaking, we continue to work with DFI and its annual film event, the Doha Tribeca Film Festival (DTFF) a cultural partnership with Tribeca Enterprises to create campaigns, events, exhibitions, publications and branded collateral in Qatar and its satellite locations in New York, Paris, and Cannes. Our work for the 2011 DTFF includes a mile-long billboard of 600 Lacombe portraits surrounding the Katara Cultural Village where the festival takes place, books documenting the "I am Film" project and the making of the Jean-Jacques Annaud film "Black Gold," and environmental projections and signage throughout the event.

item.title: Typography / RBNo2.1
item.description: RBNo2.1 is a condensed sans serif typeface with a technical and geometric appearance. The family includes 2 versions (RBNo2.1a and RBNo2.1b) and has 7 weights with matching italics. RBNo2.1 feels comfortable in technical surroundings with short text passages, in brochures, catalogs, magazines, posters, websites headlines and logos.
item.content:encoded: RBNo2.1 is a condensed sans serif typeface with a technical and geometric appearance. The family includes 2 versions (RBNo2.1a and RBNo2.1b) and has 7 weights with matching italics. RBNo2.1 feels comfortable in technical surroundings with short text passages, in brochures, catalogs, magazines, posters, websites headlines and logos.

item.title: Crocodile 60th Anniversary Brand Book
item.description: Established in 1952, Crocodile is an apparel brand that is well known as the Shirt Expert in 50s & 60s. It has more than 1,600 stores throughout Hong Kong, Macau and Mainland China. To celebrate their 60th anniversary, Crocodile first published their brand book to share their brand history. The old photos and interesting stories recall the memory and history of Hong Kong as well. We have used a vintage style layout to match with the old photos and stories.
item.content:encoded: Established in 1952, Crocodile is an apparel brand that is well known as the Shirt Expert in 50s & 60s. It has more than 1,600 stores throughout Hong Kong, Macau and Mainland China. To celebrate their 60th anniversary, Crocodile first published their brand book to share their brand history. The old photos and interesting stories recall the memory and history of Hong Kong as well. We have used a vintage style layout to match with the old photos and stories.

item.title: Custom Built Orchestra
item.description: Diego has always been fascinated by the raw musical power that an orchestra can express, so, after creating a series of videos where he performs a multi-track piece with an instrument he designed, he decided to take the concept a step farther and create his own orchestra made of unusually unique instruments. The project started by handcrafting a diverse selection of instruments, then he wrote a composition where he could fit them all in and finally he performed each part.
item.content:encoded: Diego has always been fascinated by the raw musical power that an orchestra can express, so, after creating a series of videos where he performs a multi-track piece with an instrument he designed, he decided to take the concept a step farther and create his own orchestra made of unusually unique instruments. The project started by handcrafting a diverse selection of instruments, then he wrote a composition where he could fit them all in and finally he performed each part.

item.title: THE OUTPOST
item.description: The Outpost is a magazine of possibilities. It identifies, understands and analyzes the conflicts, morals, energies and opportunities of a changing Middle East and lays down possible futures.

item.title: Outpost
item.description: Set in the remote and harsh high desert landscape of Idaho, Outpost is an artist live/work studio and sculpture garden for making and displaying art. An important aspect of the complex is the protected paradise garden, which is separated from the wild landscape by thick masonry walls. The materials used in the structure, including concrete block, car-decking, and plywood, require little to no maintenance, and are capable of withstanding the extreme weather that characterize the deserts four seasons. Outposts compactness limits site impact and reinforces the desire to be outside. The architects chose a readily available construction material concrete block for the primary structure; commercial builders were able to quickly and cheaply assemble the building. Interior materials are left largely unfinished. In a windy environment, the enclosed garden provides protection to develop a cultured space. Nothing outside the walls is modified. The footprint of the building is the limit of intrusion into the landscape a simple, clearly defined space within the landscape.
item.content:encoded: Set in the remote and harsh high desert landscape of Idaho, Outpost is an artist live/work studio and sculpture garden for making and displaying art. An important aspect of the complex is the protected paradise garden, which is separated from the wild landscape by thick masonry walls. The materials used in the structure, including concrete block, car-decking, and plywood, require little to no maintenance, and are capable of withstanding the extreme weather that characterize the deserts four seasons. Outposts compactness limits site impact and reinforces the desire to be outside. The architects chose a readily available construction material concrete block for the primary structure; commercial builders were able to quickly and cheaply assemble the building. Interior materials are left largely unfinished. In a windy environment, the enclosed garden provides protection to develop a cultured space. Nothing outside the walls is modified. The footprint of the building is the limit of intrusion into the landscape a simple, clearly defined space within the landscape.

item.title: NOKIA PURE / TYPOGRAPHY BOOK
item.description: The book,Twenty-Six Characters, details how Nokia's new typeface, Nokia Pure, was designed and developed by typographer Bruno Maag. The book is also design inspiration, a specimen sheet and a rough guide to typography. My contribution lies within the inspiration chapter, playfully exploring the usability and versatility of the font.
item.content:encoded: The book,Twenty-Six Characters, details how Nokia's new typeface, Nokia Pure, was designed and developed by typographer Bruno Maag. The book is also design inspiration, a specimen sheet and a rough guide to typography. My contribution lies within the inspiration chapter, playfully exploring the usability and versatility of the font.

item.title: Thuys at the Dolhuys
item.description: Dutch Studio Overtreders W redesigned the museum restaurant of Het Dolhuys, a museum focusing on the subject of psychiatry. The custom designed furniture was produced by clients of a psychiatric institution. The restaurant of Museum Het Dolhuys has a new interior and a new name: Thuys (Dutch for At Home). The new interior was designed by studio Overtreders W. The restaurant is based in the oldest part of the museum complex, the 14th century chapel of the original psychiatric hospital. The original function of the chapel was emphasized during the renovation, by painting the walls white and removing the plaster from the tower of the church, in which a childrens play corner was made. Among the eye-cathers of the restaurant are the counter covered with matt glazed tiles, a huge chandelier of metal boxes covered with wool felt and a modular wall system consisting of bookcases, picture frames, a panel for hanging the frames on the wall, acoustic panels and colour patches. These objects were designed with consideration for the specific qualities of people with psychiatric problems. These people are often very good at repetitive work that others would think of as boring. Therefore, the individual elements of the wall system and the boxes of the chandelier are very simple to produce, and were made by clients of two psychiatric institutions. The amount of different elements combined together make a rich and colourful whole. The sizes are based on DIN A paper sizes, to make sure all elements fit together. Some objects from the old interior returned in a new shape: the oak of an old bench was used to make a long table, the big second-hand lampshades were flocked in grey velvet and are in use again. The graphic design was made by Raw Color. pictures by Jorn van Eck
item.content:encoded: Dutch Studio Overtreders W redesigned the museum restaurant of Het Dolhuys, a museum focusing on the subject of psychiatry. The custom designed furniture was produced by clients of a psychiatric institution. The restaurant of Museum Het Dolhuys has a new interior and a new name: Thuys (Dutch for At Home). The new interior was designed by studio Overtreders W. The restaurant is based in the oldest part of the museum complex, the 14th century chapel of the original psychiatric hospital. The original function of the chapel was emphasized during the renovation, by painting the walls white and removing the plaster from the tower of the church, in which a childrens play corner was made. Among the eye-cathers of the restaurant are the counter covered with matt glazed tiles, a huge chandelier of metal boxes covered with wool felt and a modular wall system consisting of bookcases, picture frames, a panel for hanging the frames on the wall, acoustic panels and colour patches. These objects were designed with consideration for the specific qualities of people with psychiatric problems. These people are often very good at repetitive work that others would think of as boring. Therefore, the individual elements of the wall system and the boxes of the chandelier are very simple to produce, and were made by clients of two psychiatric institutions. The amount of different elements combined together make a rich and colourful whole. The sizes are based on DIN A paper sizes, to make sure all elements fit together. Some objects from the old interior returned in a new shape: the oak of an old bench was used to make a long table, the big second-hand lampshades were flocked in grey velvet and are in use again. The graphic design was made by Raw Color. pictures by Jorn van Eck
